title: Introduction to React
body: React is a library for building user interfaces. It allows efficient work with components and state.
author: John Peterson

title: Basics of Node.js
body: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime that allows running code on the server.
author: Olivia Smith

title: What is MongoDB?
body: MongoDB is a document-oriented database that stores data in BSON format.
author: Andrew Johnson

title: Using Tailwind CSS
body: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that allows quick creation of responsive interfaces.
author: Maria Ivanov

title: Redux in Large Projects
body: Redux helps manage global state in large applications, ensuring predictability and control.
author: Igor Shevchenko

title: Authentication in Express
body: For authentication in Express, libraries like Passport.js or JWT are commonly used.
author: Catherine Lee

title: GraphQL vs REST
body: GraphQL provides a more flexible approach to data queries compared to REST APIs.
author: Michael Green

title: Docker for Developers
body: Docker allows creating containers for isolated app execution and simplifies deployment.
author: Elena Brown

title: TypeScript in React Projects
body: TypeScript adds static typing, helping to avoid errors and making the code more understandable.
author: William Clark

title: CI/CD with GitHub Actions
body: GitHub Actions enables automating build, testing, and deployment of projects.
author: Svetlana Bondar
